Leadership Learning Academy plans to start the 2020-2021 school year with students coming back to our classrooms for in-person instruction. Remember, we love you and your family and only want what is best for each of you!

Stay healthy and safe!

Mrs B and the LLA Staff and Board

Good Afternoon Flyer Families,
Today a parent reported to us that a student here at LLA was approached in a neighborhood near us by a strange man. The man was asking for directions to a gas station. When the student told him where it was he asked to be shown on his phone. When the student approached the vehicle the man was exposing himself. The student immediately started screaming and running home. This was immediately reported to the police and it sounds like it has happened multiple times in Layton recently. I am sharing this with you to keep you aware. The student is upset but is ok.
The male in the car was described as looking like "Maui" on Moana and driving a red car.
Please note this did not happen on the street of our school, but a neighborhood close to here. We are watching out here as well and will immediately contact police if necessary.
We love having your children here at LLA and want them safe and happy!
Go Flyers!!
Heidi Bauerle DirectorLeadership Learning Academy
